description: a(n) = least m such that if r and s in {F(h)/F(2*h): h = 1,2,...,n} satisfy r < s, then r < k/m < s for some integer k, where F = A000045 (Fibonacci numbers).
comments: For a guide to related sequences, see A001000. - _Clark Kimberling_, Aug 07 2012
links: W. Kuszmaul, Fast Algorithms for Finding Pattern Avoiders and Counting Pattern Occurrences in Permutations, arXiv preprint arXiv:1509.08216, 2015
mathematica: leastSeparator[seq_] := Module[{n = 1},Table[While[Or @@ (Ceiling[n #1[[1]]] <2 + Floor[n #1[[2]]] &) /@ (Sort[#1, Greater] &) /@Partition[Take[seq, k], 2, 1], n++]; n, {k, 2, Length[seq]}]];t = Table[N[Fibonacci[h]/Fibonacci[2 h]], {h, 1, 30}]t1 = leastSeparator[t](* _Peter J. C. Moses_, Aug 01 2012 *)
author: _Clark Kimberling_
extensions: All the terms were corrected by _Clark Kimberling_, Aug 07 2012
